data.question: What is the title of the article?
data.answer: Near-Perfect CO2/CH4 Selectivity Achieved through Reversible Guest Templating in the Flexible Metal–Organic Framework Co(bdp)

data.question: Who is the corresponding author of the article?
data.answer: Jeffrey R. Long

data.question: What is the main focus of the research article?
data.answer: The research focuses on demonstrating the flexible metal–organic framework Co(bdp) exhibits high CO2/CH4 selectivity for gas separations.

data.question: What method was used for the crystal structure analyses?
data.answer: The program TOPAS 4.1 was used for the crystal structure analyses.

data.question: What is the significance of the CO2-induced phase change pressure in Co(bdp)?
data.answer: The CO2-induced phase change pressure is significant because it determines the conditions under which Co(bdp) can selectively adsorb CO2 over CH4.

data.question: How was the CO2/CH4 selectivity of Co(bdp) under CH4-rich conditions determined?
data.answer: The CO2/CH4 selectivity under CH4-rich conditions was determined using multicomponent equilibrium adsorption experiments.

data.question: Is Co(bdp) selective for CO2 or CH4?
data.answer: Co(bdp) is selective for CO2 over CH4.

data.question: Can the position of the CO2-induced step in Co(bdp) be controlled?
data.answer: Yes, the position of the CO2-induced step can be controlled by varying the temperature or by functionalization of the bdp2− linker.

data.question: Was the CO2 breakthrough capacity of Co(bdp) affected by the flow rate in the experiments?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the research suggest that Co(bdp) could be customized for specific separations?
data.answer: True

data.question: Did the researchers use the NIST REFPROP database for compressibility factors?
data.answer: True

data.question: Is the CO2/CH4 selectivity of Co(bdp) constant across all conditions tested?
data.answer: False

data.question: Does Co(bdp) adsorb CH4 in the presence of CO2?
data.answer: False

data.question: Was the crystal structure of Co(bdp) solved using simulated annealing?
data.answer: True

data.question: Is the adsorption behavior of Co(bdp) independent of temperature?
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the role of helium in the breakthrough experiments?
data.answer: Helium was used as a non-adsorbing probe gas to collect breakthrough curves under equivalent conditions.

data.question: What was the main challenge in forming pellets of Co(bdp) for breakthrough experiments?
data.answer: The main challenge was the difficulty in forming pellets capable of withstanding the large volume change of the framework upon adsorption.

data.question: How was the CO2 breakthrough capacity of Co(bdp) calculated?
data.answer: The CO2 breakthrough capacity was calculated using the normalized outlet flow rate and composition as a function of bed volumes.

data.question: What was observed in the CO2/CH4 breakthrough experiment at 7 bar absolute pressure?
data.answer: Co(bdp) selectively adsorbed CO2 and negligible CH4 from a 50:50 CO2:CH4 mixture at 7 bar.

data.question: What does the unusual CO2 breakthrough profile in Co(bdp) indicate?
data.answer: The unusual CO2 breakthrough profile indicates the inability of Co(bdp) to capture CO2 at partial pressures below the CO2 phase change pressure.
